entry.title: Activity Rate Planning & Activity Rate Calculation OPEX Planning & IFP
entry.content:
Hello all,

Can anyone please help me understand the purpose and difference between Cost Center Activity Cost Rate Planning and Cost Center Activity Cost Rate Calculation in IFP OPEX? I’m unable to grasp this point. I can clearly understand expense planning, project expense planning, and even activity cost rate planning — but I don’t quite see the need for incorporating Cost Center Activity Cost Rate Calculation.

entry.title: How to launch automatically a dynamic hyperlink of a report with its cuid in SAP BO
entry.content:
Hi , 

We have a dimension ( name ->Object )  in sap BO 4.2 which contains names of several reports and we would like to launch them automatically  in a new window visualizing the content of the report directly  without customizing every link manually using OpenDocument but  identifying every report using its cuid. 

We think that only we can do that based on the universe level but even doing that based on universe level we have to do it manually  (Hyperlink with OpenDocument ). Can't we ?

Please let me know your solution to do it automatically 

Thanks in advance

To define an object as a dynamic hyperlink  (UDT)

  1. Right-click on the object and select Object Properties.
    The Edit Object Properties dialog displays.
  2. Type the select statement and include the appropriate hyperlink.
  3. Save the new properties.
  4. Right-click on the object and select Object Format.
    The Object Format pane displays.
  5. Select the option Read As Hyperlink.
  6. Click OK to save the format settings.
  7. Use your reporting tool to create the report and test the link

entry.title: Extracting SAP S/4HANA Data (Tables & CDS Views) to External Storages
entry.content:
Hey

I’m looking into options for extracting data from SAP S/4HANA (tables and CDS views) into external, non-SAP storages such as AWS S3 / Redshift or Oracle.

So far, I see a few directions, but I couldn’t find a clear statement on SAP’s official strategy for:

  • SAP-native options
  • Third-party tools (how does SAP position ETL tools such as Informatica or Theobald? Are those SAP-certified?)
  • SAP’s current position on BDC? Specifically Datasphere, which could also be used for data replication to an external target database?

Any references (SAP Notes, blogs, architecture guides, or project experience) would be very helpful.

entry.title: Integrated Financial Planning OPEX Cost Rates Data Action
entry.content:
Hey All, 

 

Could anyone help me understand a part of the standard IFP content?
In the Cost Center Activity Cost Rate Calculation, under the Cost Rate section, there is a data action called “Calculate CCtr Activity Cost Rates with Account-Based Split”.

Within its code, I came across the following line, and I’m unsure of its purpose. When I try debugging, it shows empty values:

DATA([d/Measures] = #M2, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/ALLOCATION_ACCOUNT]) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #M1)

 

FOR @Counter = 1 TO 100
IF [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] != "#" THEN
// Reset #COST for next iteration
DATA([d/Measures] = #COST, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CODEBITCREDITCODE] = "D", [d/Date] = #T1) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #COST, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CODEBITCREDITCODE] = "D", [d/Date] = #T1) * 0

entry.title: S4 tables for Invoice Lifecycle Report?
entry.content:
In the SAP S4 Invoice Life Cycle Report, for a particular document ID (for example: 12345) there are several rows underneath, including one with a particular current agent called BLOGGSJ (fake name for example). The process type is Vendor Mismatch (PO).

Using Alteryx with SAP connectors I pulled all records from CDHDR with the BLOGGSJ username field, and then the CDPOS rows joining on OBJECTID and CHANGENR.

However, when I search the document ID I see on the invoice life cycle report (12345), I can't find it in there anywhere.

Is there a different table that records these actions that I should be pulling from instead of CDHDR/CDPOS?

entry.title: Some duplicated values on SAC export
entry.content:
Hello, I'm kinda stumped by something and need any help I could get. 

I've built a dashoard on SAC which is a big inventory table. When I export the table to Excel, some rows (around 2 or 3% of the total) display duplicated values on Excel. However, on the SAC interface and on DSP, they're showing the correct values. 

Any idea what is happening? 

EDIT: Thank you for responses, I figured out what was the origin of the issue: I had two calculated dimension using the same field, when I took these off, my export was correct. We suspect it might be related to language translation on those fileds, we will be opening a case with SAP.

entry.title: Dataphere and Custom CDS views
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm wondering, is it possible to use Datasphere delta refresh option with custom CDS views ?
If yes what should I do first ?

Thanks for your help.

entry.title: CDS view: Which annotations do I need for BW extraction? (CDS entity)
entry.content:
Dear all,

I need to extract data from a custom table in S/4HANA to BW/4HANA. To achieve this, I've created a CDS view defined as view entity.
When adding the annotation  Analytics.dataExtraction.enabled = true , the message "data extraction for CDS entity is not possible" is shown. I have read, that I should change the property "API state" of the CDS view to enable the use as "Remote API (Contract C2)". But when activating this, the following warnings are shown:

Use of annotation ABAPCATALOG.VIEWENHANCEMENTCATEGORY is not allowed.
Use of annotation ANALYTICS.DATACATEGORY is not allowed.
Use of annotation ANALYTICS.DATAEXTRACTION.DELTA.CHANGEDATACAPTURE.AUTOMATIC is not allowed.
Use of annotation ANALYTICS.DATAEXTRACTION.ENABLED is not allowed.

This is my CDS coding:

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'CDS-based BW extraction: table Zxxx_ABC'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: false
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
    serviceQuality: #D,
    sizeCategory: #L,
    dataClass: #MIXED }
@analytics: {
    dataCategory: #FACT,
    dataExtraction: {
    enabled: true,
    delta.changeDataCapture.automatic: true }
}

define view entity ZC_BW_Zxxx_ABC as select from Zxxx_ABC
{
...
}

What is my mistake? Should I ignore the warning messages?

Thanks & kind regards,
Yvonne

entry.title: Integrated Financial Planning CAPEX Delta Planning Data Action
entry.content:
Hello All,

Could anyone please help me with this? I’m reviewing the standard code for the data action Delta Planning in CAPEX. While executing the first part of the code using trace points/debugging, I’m unable to understand the logic behind the value that appears in the AMOUNT_DELTA measure (750).

Can someone assist me in figuring out how this value is being derived?

this is the logic I am debugging in standard code of calculating depreciation delta amount 

//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//Set Configurations Definitions for the Advanced Formulas.
//------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
CONFIG.HIERARCHY.INCLUDE_MEMBERS_NOT_IN_HIERARCHY = [d/SAP_ALL_COMPANY_CODE], [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_PROFITCENTER]
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//The data region against which the formulas will be executed.
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA"
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate] TO [d/Version].[p/EndDate]
VARIABLEMEMBER #RESIDUAL_VALUE OF [d/Measures]
VARIABLEMEMBER #CUMMUL_VALUE OF [d/Measures]
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//Calculation and Data Writing
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//FOREACH [d/Date]
// Staight-Line Depreciation Method: Cummulative Acquisition Value * Depriciation Percentage / 12 Periods
IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_METHOD", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") = 1 THEN
DATA([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA",[d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/DepreciationAccount]) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) *
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_PERCENTAGE", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") / 12
ENDIF

entry.title: Unable to Find Defect Table History in Cloud ALM API Integration
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We’ve successfully established a connection to the SAP Cloud ALM API and are able to retrieve data. However, we’re currently facing an issue: we cannot locate the historical data for the defect table.

We’ve checked the available endpoints and documentation, but haven’t found a clear way to access past defect records or any kind of change history.

Has anyone encountered this before or knows if there’s a specific API endpoint or configuration needed to retrieve defect history?

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: NDC Converter 2.0: Automating Your Journey from BusinessObjects to Cloud Analytics
entry.content:
SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) provides a unified platform for data ingestion, semantic modeling, governance and analytics. For teams migrating from SAP BusinessObjects (BO), BDC enables:

  • A governed semantic layer in SAP Datasphere that faithfully reproduces and extends your existing BO universes with standardized naming conventions, hierarchies and calculated measures.
  • Cloud-native analytics in SAC for reporting, planning and predictive scenarios, powered by either live data connections or scheduled replication jobs.
  • A clear modernization path for SAP BW/4HANA artifacts and non-SAP sources, preserving embedded business logic while consolidating disparate models.

By porting Web Intelligence (WebI) content into BDC, you can retire legacy BO infrastructure and establish a sustainable foundation built on remote or replicated tables, graphical and SQL views and published semantic models that are fully consumable in SAC.

 

In this follow-up to our NDC Converter introduction, we’ll showcase its newest capabilities and zoom in on how REST APIs, RPA and the SAP BDC stack work together to fully automate your migration workflow and eliminate uncertainty that is often associated with these sorts of projects.

Analysis & clean-up

Migration kicks off with a thorough source analysis powered by our enhanced scanning engine. After installing a lightweight Windows executable in your environment, NDC Converter uses the BusinessObjects REST API to perform a repository-wide scan - cataloging WebI documents, variables, filters and data sources. Parallel processing enables multiple report structures to be inventoried simultaneously, cutting traditional analysis times from days to hours.

If BO access is restricted, you can export a full content catalog instead and NDC Converter will generate a self-service metadata report for rapid sizing and compliance checks. These automated scans deliver hard metrics on:

  • Volume: total reports, pages, charts and objects
  • Complexity: calculations, variables, dimensions and interactive features
  • Usage: inactive or overlapping content

Armed with this detailed data, we can scope migration efforts accurately within days rather than weeks, giving prospects immediate insight into their BI landscape without manual, time-consuming analysis.

Automated report migration

Once WebI queries are identified, the next step is to align them with target system (usually SAP Datasphere but other options available too – for reference see previous blog post). Steps here include:

  • Linking each WebI query to its target system
  • Generating the necessary migration definitions
  • Automatically provisioning and deploying the corresponding tables

If you’re working with many tables, the “mass deploy” feature lets you push them live in bulk—no tedious one-by-one clicks.

After tables are deployed, we configure on-demand or scheduled data replication to maintain synchronization between target and source systems, followed by creating graphical and SQL-based views to implement calculation logic. The final step is to publish these views to SAP Analytics Cloud where up-to-date data can be accessed.

The data source layer migration involves analyzing the BO repository, migrating universe metadata and/or transitioning live models based on BEx queries. Upon completion of the initial data migration, a comprehensive semantic model is introduced that mirrors your original WebI structures including dimensions, measures, hierarchies and data. This transformation provides a cloud-ready foundation for all SAP Analytics Cloud initiatives.

NDC Converter 2.0

With your semantic model live, we proceed with WebI reports migration into SAP Analytics Cloud as interactive stories with new high functional coverage. NDC Converter retrieves each report’s layout, structures, tables, charts, filters and visual elements via the BusinessObjects REST API. A blueprint compatible with RPA processing is produced, covering:

  • Layout & structure: multi‑page documents, IDs, descriptions, pages/tabs.
  • Tables & crosstabs: calculated and restricted measures, variables and common WebI calculations.
  • Charts: Bar/Column, Line, Numeric Point, Pie, Donut, Heat Map, Tree Map, Bubble, Scatterplot.
  • Formatting & UX: predefined template stories, titles, text, headers/footers, icons.
  • Filters & interactivity: input controls, query filters, single object filters, drill, hyperlinks.

The RPA bot, delivered as a Chrome extension, reads this blueprint and automates the reconstruction of each report in SAC Story 2.0, preserving original tables, crosstabs, charts, parameters and filters. The resulting SAC Stories mirror your WebI reports while leveraging cloud-native data models.

What stays manual (and why)

NDC Converter automates routine migration tasks, allowing your team to focus on strategic design and governance – here are cases where automation does not bring added value:

  • Data model (business semantics) design: turning technical structures into robust semantic layer requires continuous alignment on reporting vision.
  • Edge cases & redesign: in situations where 1:1 replication isn’t optimal, we propose a workaround solution to comply with business and technical needs.
  • Environment setup: Migrating users, roles and platform configurations using a mix of guided best practices and selective automation.

Collaborate end-end delivery

NDC Converter is an ideal tool for complex migration scenarios, automating the transfer of every structural element—from metadata and queries to filters and visual object definitions. Once the converter has recreated the report skeletons in SAC, your BI team can take over the final steps: refining layouts, adjusting chart properties and validating calculation logic. This collaborative workflow ensures that the most time-consuming technical migrations are handled automatically, while you retain full control over presentation, branding and business requirements.

entry.title: moving/rolling sum for specific amount of dates in SAC
entry.content:
Hello community,

I have a requirement to calculate a rolling sum over 7 days in this case. And I want to visualize this value over time in a chart.

Here is an example of how the calculation should look like:

Datesales7 day sum
01.09.2025125125
02.09.2025100225
03.09.202575300
04.09.2025250550
05.09.2025100650
06.09.20253501000
07.09.20252751275
08.09.20251501300
09.09.20251001300
10.09.20251101335

The calculation function for running total does not really work here, because of the missing option to restrict the time period to 7 days. I have also tried this formula: ResultLookup([sales] ;[date]= PREVIOUS(90; "DAY";[date]))  but unfortunately the system does not allow the function PREVIOUS to be used in this context. 

I am using an analytical model from SAP Datasphere as source.

Does anybody know a solution to this problem?

Im creating a CDS report and want to replicate some of the details in the "Monitor Purchase Order Items" app. I can see most of the fields required in the CDS I_PurOrdScheduleLineAPI01 but it doesn't have the Delivered Value and Invoiced Value. 

Can anyone assist with what views I can include into my custom CDS to get these values included? 

Thanks

Adam

entry.title: Can you link/join a MATDOC record to the corresponding idoc record
entry.content: Can you link/join a MATDOC table record to the corresponding idoc record for that MATDOC entry?  Looking for a way to positively identify which idoc record is responsible for any given entry in the MATDOC table.

entry.title: HTTPS on RESTful web service running on tomcat
entry.content:
Currently we have this setup. RESTful web service running on WACS (http://server:6405/biprws), BI and CMC application running on tomcat (https://server:8443/BOE/BI). Server is SSL configured and we have a 8080 reroute to 8443.

We want to decouple RESTful web service from WACS and have it running on tomcat instead. Changing the RESTful url to http://server:8080/biprws doesn't work. It gives us a HTTP 500 error. Same if changed to https://server:8443/biprws.

Any ideas on this?

entry.title: How Can Organizations Architect a Scalable Data Engineering Pipeline to Support Real-Time AI-Driven
entry.content:
How Can Organizations Architect a Scalable Data Engineering Pipeline to Support Real-Time AI-Driven Decision Making Across Multiple Domains?

Hello everyone,

I’m working on designing a data engineering pipeline that can support real-time AI analytics across multiple business domains, including marketing, operations, and supply chain. I want to ensure that our architecture is scalable, resilient, and compliant with data privacy regulations.

Specifically, I’m looking for insights on:

Data Ingestion & Streaming: What are the best practices for ingesting large-scale structured and unstructured data in near real-time? Which tools or frameworks are most effective for multi-source streaming pipelines?

Data Storage & Modeling: How can we efficiently store both batch and streaming data while maintaining a single source of truth for AI models? Are there recommended data lake or warehouse strategies?

Feature Engineering for AI: How can feature pipelines be automated and monitored to ensure high-quality inputs for machine learning models without introducing bias?

Real-Time Model Deployment: What architecture patterns (e.g., event-driven, micro-batching, or hybrid) best support real-time AI inference while minimizing latency?

Governance & Compliance: How do organizations ensure data privacy, lineage, and regulatory compliance while enabling agile AI experimentation?

Has anyone implemented a production-ready solution that addresses these challenges? I’d love to hear about architectural choices, tool recommendations, pitfalls, and lessons learned from real-world implementations.

entry.title: How Are Data Engineering Services Driving Digital Transformation in the USA
entry.content:
In today’s fast-changing digital landscape, Data Engineering Services are at the core of how U.S. companies manage, process, and use data to stay competitive.

I’d like to hear from industry experts and professionals — how are organizations in the USA leveraging Data Engineering Services to drive their digital transformation efforts?

Are these services helping businesses build reliable data pipelines, migrate to the cloud, or enable real-time analytics for smarter decisions?

Let’s discuss!
 How do you see Data Engineering Services shaping the future of digital transformation in the United States?

entry.title: Missing Authorization S_DEVELOP when Creating Analytical List Page (S/4HANA public Cloud)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am attempting to create a report based on the documentation I found for reporting in S/4HANA Public Cloud. I am working as a Key User in the Client 100 environment, using an SAP physical inventory standard data source.

My Steps So Far:

  1. I created a Custom CDS View of the Analytical Cube type.

  2. I then created a Custom Analytical Query based on that Cube.

  3. When I try to proceed to Manage KPIs and Reports and select Create Analytical List Page, I immediately receive the following error:

    "Missing authorization S_DEVELOP"

The Problem:

My online research suggests that the S_DEVELOP error is typically related to development activities outside of the Fiori apps (such as creation via ADT/Eclipse). However:

  • I am not using Eclipse or any external development tools; I am using the standard Key User apps within the Fiori Launchpad.

  • I have been assigned all roles, including the Admin role, and development, in both environments.

  • All CDS and Query are activated and published.

Additional Information:

I also tried to find the Manage KPIs and Reports app in the Client 80 environment, but it does not appear to be available there.

Does anyone know why the S_DEVELOP authorization is being requested in the Client 100 environment when creating this object purely as a Key User without using any external development tools?

Any insight would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you.
